00064     /// @internal
00065     /// @namespace phys::debug
00066     /// @brief This namespace is for internal debugging tools. In general it shouldn't be used in game code.
00067     /// @details This whole debug namespace is a dirty hack. This is where internal only classes and functions go
00068     /// that can and maybe should be ommited from release builds
00069     namespace debug
00070     {
00071         /// @internal
00072         /// @class InternalDebugDrawer
00073         /// @brief This is used to draw wireframse for the Physics subsystem
00074         class InternalDebugDrawer : public btIDebugDraw
00075         {
00076             private:
00077                 /// @internal
00078                 /// @brief A pointer to phys::World that this Debug Drawer works with
00079                 World* ParentWorld;
00080 
00081                 /// @internal
00082                 /// @brief How many wireframes do you want to keep around on the screen.
00083                 Whole WireFrameCount;
00084 
00085                 /// @internal
00086                 /// @brief This queue stores The listing of of the wireframes still to be rendered.
00087                 /// @details This stores an amount of wireframes up to the WireFrameCount. When this class is created or a
00088                 /// new frame rendered a new Line group is a added to this queue.
00089                 std::queue<phys::LineGroup*> WireFrames;
00090 
00091                 /// @internal
00092                 /// @brief This stores whether or not to render physics debug lines
00093                 /// @details This stores whether or not to render physics debud lines. 0 = Do not draw anything. 1 = Draw model wireframes.
00094                 /// Later we will add support for contact drawing, individual modeling drawing, etc...
00095                 int DebugDrawing;
00096             public:
00097                 /// @internal
00098                 /// @brief Basic Constructor
00099                 /// @param ParentWorld_ This is a Pointer to the world to be rendered
00100                 /// @param WireFrameCount_ This sets the amount of previous Wireframes to be rendered, see InternalDebugDrawer::SetWireFrameCount for details.
00101                 /// @details This creates a basic Debug Drawer which works with the phys::World that was passed. With a new
00102                 InternalDebugDrawer(phys::World *ParentWorld_, Whole WireFrameCount_ = 2);
00103 
00104                 /// @internal
00105                 /// @brief Destructor
00106                 /// @details This deletes all the Wireframes and will stop wireframe rendering
00107                 ~InternalDebugDrawer();
00108 
00109                 /// @internal
00110                 /// @brief This will prepare a line segment for being drawn
00111                 /// @details This adds the points for a line to the internal list of points to be rendered.
00112                 /// @param from The first point of the line
00113                 /// @param to The second point of the line
00114                 /// @param color Currently ignored
00115                 virtual void drawLine(const btVector3& from,const btVector3& to,const btVector3& color);
00116 
00117                 /// @internal
00118                 /// @brief This add all the rendering information to the graphics subsystem
00119                 /// @details This sends all the points in the list of lines to the rendering subsystem(currently ogre), where they will stay until deleted
00120                 virtual void PrepareForRendering();
00121 
00122                 /// @internal
00123                 /// @brief Sets the amount of previous wireframes to leave visible.
00124                 /// @details This will limit the amount of previous wireframes drawn. Setting this will cause all the extra wireframes to be deleted
00125                 /// InternalDebugDrawer::PrepareForRendering() is next called, which should happen just before everything is rendered.
00126                 /// @param WireFrameCount_ This is a whole number which is limit.
00127                 virtual void SetWireFrameCount(Whole WireFrameCount_);
00128 
00129                 /// @internal
00130                 /// @brief This returns the amount of wireframes to be drawn
00131                 /// @details This returns either 2 or the amount last set by InternalDebugDrawer::SetWireFrameCount .
00132                 /// @return This returns a whole number with the wireframe limit.
00133                 virtual Whole GetWireFrameCount();
00134 
00135                 /// @internal
00136                 /// @brief Currently Unused
00137                 /// @details Currently Unused
00138                 /// @param PointOnB Currently Unused
00139                 /// @param normalOnB Currently Unused
00140                 /// @param distance Currently Unused
00141                 /// @param lifeTime Currently Unused
00142                 /// @param color Currently Unused
00143                 virtual void drawContactPoint(const btVector3& PointOnB,const btVector3& normalOnB,btScalar distance,int lifeTime,const btVector3& color);
00144 
00145                 /// @internal
00146                 /// @brief Used by the physics subsystem to report errors using the renderer
00147                 /// @details We *Believe* that this is used by the physics subsystem to report errors about rendering to the developer/user. As such, we
00148                 /// Have redirected all input from this function to the World::Log function.
00149                 /// @param warningString We *Believe* These are messagesfrom the physics subsystem, and that this should not directly called otherwise
00150                 virtual void reportErrorWarning(const char* warningString);
00151 
00152                 /// @internal
00153                 /// @brief Currently Unused
00154                 /// @details Currently Unused
00155                 /// @param location Currently Unused
00156                 /// @param textString Currently Unused
00157                 virtual void draw3dText(const btVector3& location, const char* textString);
00158 
00159                 /// @internal
00160                 /// @brief This is used to decide how much the debug render should draw
00161                 /// @details Currently this accepts btIDebugDraw::DBG_NoDebug or btIDebugDraw::DBG_DrawWireframe and setting these will either start or stop
00162                 /// Wireframe rendering. All other btIDebugDraw values are ignored.
00163                 /// @param debugMode An Int which contains either btIDebugDraw::DBG_NoDebug or btIDebugDraw::DBG_DrawWireframe
00164                 virtual void setDebugMode(int debugMode);
00165 
00166                 /// @internal
00167                 /// @brief This will return the current debug mode.
00168                 /// @details Currently this can only return btIDebugDraw::DBG_NoDebug or btIDebugDraw::DBG_DrawWireframe
00169                 /// @return Returns the Current debug mode, currently either btIDebugDraw::DBG_NoDebug or btIDebugDraw::DBG_DrawWireframe
00170                 virtual int getDebugMode() const;
00171         };
00172 
00173         InternalDebugDrawer::InternalDebugDrawer( phys::World *ParentWorld_, Whole WireFrameCount_ )
00174         {
00175             this->DebugDrawing = 0;
00176             this->ParentWorld = ParentWorld_;
00177 
00178             this->WireFrameCount = WireFrameCount_;
00179 
00180             //phys::LineGroup* temp = new phys::LineGroup(this->ParentWorld);
00181             this->WireFrames.push(new phys::LineGroup(this->ParentWorld));
00182         }
00183 
00184         InternalDebugDrawer::~InternalDebugDrawer()
00185         {
00186             while ( ! this->WireFrames.empty() )
00187             {
00188                 delete this->WireFrames.front();
00189                 this->WireFrames.pop();
00190             }
00191         }
00192 
00193         void InternalDebugDrawer::drawLine(const btVector3& from,const btVector3& to,const btVector3& color)
00194         {
00195             phys::LineGroup *myLine = this->WireFrames.back();
00196 
00197             //Convert btVectors to PhysVector3s
00198             Vector3 LineStart(from);
00199             Vector3 LineEnd(to);
00200 
00201             myLine->addPoint(LineStart);
00202             myLine->addPoint(LineEnd);
00203         }
00204 
00205         void InternalDebugDrawer::drawContactPoint(const btVector3& PointOnB,const btVector3& normalOnB,btScalar distance,int lifeTime,const btVector3& color)
00206         {
00207 
00208         }

00210         void InternalDebugDrawer::reportErrorWarning(const char* warningString)
00211         {
00212             String temp(warningString);
00213             this->ParentWorld->Log(temp);
00214         }
00215 
00216         void InternalDebugDrawer::draw3dText(const btVector3& location,const char* textString)
00217         {}
00218 
00219         void InternalDebugDrawer::setDebugMode(int debugMode)
00220         {
00221             this->DebugDrawing = debugMode;
00222         }
00223 
00224         int InternalDebugDrawer::getDebugMode() const
00225         {
00226             return this->DebugDrawing;
00227         }
00228 
00229         void InternalDebugDrawer::PrepareForRendering()
00230         {
00231             if(!this->WireFrames.empty())
00232             {
00233                 this->WireFrames.back()->drawLines();
00234             }
00235 
00236             //Delete extra wireframes
00237             while ( this->WireFrames.size() > this->WireFrameCount )
00238             {
00239                 delete this->WireFrames.front();
00240                 this->WireFrames.pop();
00241             }
00242 
00243             //This will add the Ogre Scene Nodes to the world and set up a
00244             this->WireFrames.back()->PrepareForRendering();
00245             this->WireFrames.push(new phys::LineGroup(this->ParentWorld));
00246         }
00247 
00248         void InternalDebugDrawer::SetWireFrameCount(Whole WireFrameCount_)
00249         {
00250             this->WireFrameCount = WireFrameCount_;
00251         }
00252 
00253         Whole InternalDebugDrawer::GetWireFrameCount()
00254         {
00255             return this->WireFrameCount;
00256         }

00263     PhysicsManager::PhysicsManager()
00264     {
00265         this->Construct(Vector3(-10.0,-10.0,-10.0), Vector3(10.0,10.0,10.0), 10);
00266     }

00268     PhysicsManager::PhysicsManager(const Vector3 &GeographyLowerBounds_, const Vector3 &GeographyUpperbounds_, const unsigned short int &MaxPhysicsProxies_)
00269     {
00270         this->Construct(GeographyLowerBounds_, GeographyUpperbounds_, MaxPhysicsProxies_);
00271     }

00273     PhysicsManager::~PhysicsManager()
00274     {
00275         //Destroy the physical world that we loved and cherished
00276         delete BulletDynamicsWorld;
00277         delete BulletDispatcher;
00278         delete BulletCollisionConfiguration;
00279         delete BulletSolver;
00280         delete BulletBroadphase;
00281         delete BulletDrawer;
00282 
00283     }
00284 
00285     void PhysicsManager::Construct(const Vector3 &GeographyLowerBounds_, const Vector3 &GeographyUpperbounds_, const unsigned short int &MaxPhysicsProxies_)
00286     {
00287         this->Priority = -30;
00288 
00289         //instantiate the Physics engine and related items
00290         //this->PhysicsStepsize = btScalar(1.)/btScalar(60.);
00291 
00292         this->GeographyLowerBounds = GeographyLowerBounds_;
00293         this->GeographyUpperBounds = GeographyUpperbounds_;
00294         this->MaxPhysicsProxies = MaxPhysicsProxies_;
00295 
00296         this->BulletBroadphase = new btAxisSweep3(  GeographyLowerBounds.GetBulletVector3(),
00297                                                     GeographyUpperBounds.GetBulletVector3(),
00298                                                     MaxPhysicsProxies
00299                                                  );
00300 
00301         this->GhostCallback = new btGhostPairCallback();
00302         this->BulletBroadphase->getOverlappingPairCache()->setInternalGhostPairCallback(GhostCallback);
00303 
00304         this->BulletSolver = new btSequentialImpulseConstraintSolver;
00305         //this->BulletCollisionConfiguration = new btDefaultCollisionConfiguration();
00306         this->BulletCollisionConfiguration = new btSoftBodyRigidBodyCollisionConfiguration();
00307         this->BulletDispatcher = new btCollisionDispatcher(BulletCollisionConfiguration);
00308         btGImpactCollisionAlgorithm::registerAlgorithm(BulletDispatcher);
00309 
00310         this->BulletDynamicsWorld = new btSoftRigidDynamicsWorld(
00311                                                     BulletDispatcher,
00312                                                     BulletBroadphase,
00313                                                     BulletSolver,
00314                                                     BulletCollisionConfiguration);
00315 
00316         this->BulletDynamicsWorld->getWorldInfo().m_dispatcher = this->BulletDispatcher;
00317         this->BulletDynamicsWorld->getWorldInfo().m_broadphase = this->BulletBroadphase;
00318         this->BulletDynamicsWorld->getWorldInfo().m_sparsesdf.Initialize();
00319 
00320         this->BulletDynamicsWorld->getDispatchInfo().m_enableSPU = true;
00321 
00322         this->CollisionAge=1;
00323         this->Impulse=1.0;
00324     }
00325 
00326     void PhysicsManager::Initialize()
00327     {
00328         // This came from the Game init function, and may need to go to a game init.
00329         this->BulletDrawer = new debug::InternalDebugDrawer(this->GameWorld);
00330         this->BulletDynamicsWorld->setDebugDrawer(this->BulletDrawer);
00331     }
00332 
00333     void PhysicsManager::DoMainLoopItems()
00334     {
00335         this->DoMainLoopItems(this->GameWorld->GetFrameTime());
00336     }
00337 
00338     void PhysicsManager::DoMainLoopItems(const Real &TimeElapsed)
00339     {
00340         ProcessAllEffects();
00341 
00342         Real FloatTime = TimeElapsed;
00343         FloatTime *= 0.0001;    //Convert from MilliSeconds to Seconds
00344 
00345         Real IdealStep = this->GameWorld->GetTargetFrameTime();
00346         IdealStep *= 0.0001;
00347 
00348         //int MaxSteps = (FloatTime<IdealStep) ? 1 : int(FloatTime/IdealStep+1);
00349         int MaxSteps = (FloatTime<IdealStep) ? 1 : int(FloatTime/IdealStep+2);  //used 2 simply to be extra safe
00350         this->BulletDynamicsWorld->stepSimulation( FloatTime, MaxSteps, IdealStep);
00351 
00352         if( this->BulletDrawer->getDebugMode() )        //this part is responsible for drawing the wireframes
00353         {
00354             this->BulletDrawer->PrepareForRendering();
00355             this->BulletDynamicsWorld->debugDrawWorld();
00356         }
00357 
00358         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00359         this->GameWorld->Log("Checking for Collisions.");
00360         #endif
00361 
00362         int numManifolds = BulletDynamicsWorld->getDispatcher()->getNumManifolds();
00363         for (int i=0;i<numManifolds;i++)
00364         {
00365             btPersistentManifold* contactManifold = BulletDynamicsWorld->getDispatcher()->getManifoldByIndexInternal(i);
00366             int numContacts = contactManifold->getNumContacts();
00367             for (int j=0;j<numContacts;j++)
00368             {
00369                 btManifoldPoint& pt = contactManifold->getContactPoint(j);
00370                 if (pt.m_lifeTime==CollisionAge && pt.m_appliedImpulse>=Impulse)
00371                 {
00372                     btCollisionObject* objectA = static_cast<btCollisionObject*>(contactManifold->getBody0());
00373                     btCollisionObject* objectB = static_cast<btCollisionObject*>(contactManifold->getBody1());
00374                     ActorBase* ActA = this->GameWorld->GetActorManager()->FindActor(objectA);
00375                     ActorBase* ActB = this->GameWorld->GetActorManager()->FindActor(objectB);
00376                     Vector3 emptyloc(0,0,0);
00377                     EventCollision* ColEvent = new EventCollision(ActA, ActB, emptyloc, pt.m_appliedImpulse);
00378                     //create collision event
00379                     this->GameWorld->GetEventManager()->AddEvent(ColEvent);
00380                     #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00381                     this->GameWorld->Log("Collision Event Logged at:");
00382                     this->GameWorld->Log(emptyloc);
00383                     #endif
00384                 }
00385             }
00386         }
00387     }

00411     void PhysicsManager::SetIndividualGravity(ActorBase* Actor, Vector3 igrav)
00412     {
00413         if (ActorBase::Actorrigid==Actor->GetType())
00414         {
00415             btRigidBody* Rigid = static_cast < btRigidBody* >(Actor->CollisionObject);
00416             Rigid->setGravity(igrav.GetBulletVector3());
00417         }
00418     }

00423     void PhysicsManager::SetDebugPhysicsRendering(int ToBeEnabled)
00424     {
00425         if(ToBeEnabled)
00426         {
00427             this->BulletDynamicsWorld->getDebugDrawer()->setDebugMode(btIDebugDraw::DBG_DrawWireframe);
00428         }else{
00429             this->BulletDynamicsWorld->getDebugDrawer()->setDebugMode(btIDebugDraw::DBG_NoDebug);
00430         }
00431     }

00433     int PhysicsManager::GetDebugPhysicsRendering()
00434     {
00435         if(this->BulletDrawer->getDebugMode()==btIDebugDraw::DBG_DrawWireframe)
00436         {
00437             return 1;
00438         }else{
00439             return 0;
00440         }
00441     }

00458     Vector3 PhysicsManager::GetActorOffset(const Vector3WActor &OffsetInfo)
00459     {
00460         if(ActorBase::Actorrigid==OffsetInfo.Actor->GetType())
00461         {
00462             btRigidBody* Rigid = static_cast< btRigidBody* > (OffsetInfo.Actor->CollisionObject);
00463             Vector3 Offset(Rigid->getCenterOfMassTransform().inverse() * OffsetInfo.Vector.GetBulletVector3());
00464             return Offset;
00465         }else{
00466             Vector3 Offset(0,0,0);
00467             return Offset;
00468         }
00469     }

00481     void PhysicsManager::AddAreaEffect(AreaEffect* AE)
00482     {
00483         this->AreaEffects.push_back(AE);
00484         this->BulletDynamicsWorld->addCollisionObject(AE->Ghost,btBroadphaseProxy::SensorTrigger,btBroadphaseProxy::AllFilter & ~btBroadphaseProxy::SensorTrigger);
00485     }
00486 
00487     void PhysicsManager::RemoveAreaEffect(AreaEffect* AE)
00488     {
00489         this->BulletDynamicsWorld->removeCollisionObject(AE->Ghost);
00490         for( vector<AreaEffect*>::iterator c=AreaEffects.begin(); c!=AreaEffects.end(); c++)
00491         {
00492             if ( AE == *c )
00493             {
00494                 c=AreaEffects.erase(c);
00495             }
00496         }
00497     }
00498 
00499     AreaEffect* PhysicsManager::GetAreaEffect(String Name)
00500     {
00501         for( vector<AreaEffect*>::iterator c=AreaEffects.begin(); c!=AreaEffects.end(); c++)
00502         {
00503             if ( Name == (*c)->GetName() )
00504             {
00505                 return *c;
00506             }
00507         }
00508         return NULL;
00509     }
00510 
00511     void PhysicsManager::ProcessAllEffects()
00512     {
00513         if( !AreaEffects.empty() )
00514         {
00515             for( vector<AreaEffect*>::iterator c=AreaEffects.begin(); c!=AreaEffects.end(); c++)
00516             {
00517                 (*c)->UpdateActorList();
00518                 (*c)->ApplyEffect();
00519             }
00520         }
00521     }

00523     void PhysicsManager::StorePhysicsShape(ActorBase* Actor, String &ShapeName)
00524     {
00525         this->PhysicsShapes[ShapeName] = Actor->Shape;
00526         Actor->ShapeIsSaved = true;
00527     }
00528 
00529     void PhysicsManager::ApplyPhysicsShape(ActorBase* Actor, String &ShapeName)
00530     {
00531         Actor->Shape = this->PhysicsShapes[ShapeName];
00532         Actor->ShapeIsSaved = true;
00533     }
